statement.p: Emilia is conducting market research on the cost of auto insurance. Emilia has determined that the average annual cost of auto insurance is 1143, and that the distribution of costs is normally distributed with a standard deviation of 83.
a. Find the probability that a single randomly selected consumer spends less than 1221 on auto insurance.
b. The cost of the middle 50 of auto insurance policies falls between (round to the nearest dollar):
c. The most expensive 8 of auto insurance policies cost at least how much annually?

b. For the middle 50 of the data, need the remaining 50 of the data split between the left and right tails of the distribution. So the lower bound of the range has \displaystyle{0.25} of the area to the left and the upper bound of the range has \displaystyle{0.25} of the area to the right, which means \displaystyle{0.75} to the left.
